items.title: Roblox players are going to start getting paid to watch ads
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Roblox is launching "Rewarded Video ads" that pay players with in-game currency and power-ups for watching ads.
- These full-screen video ads can be up to 30 seconds long and will be available for purchase via Google’s advertising solutions.
- Only public experiences owned by users over 18 will be eligible to show ads, and they will target players aged 13 and older.
- The ads are part of an expansion of Google’s "Immersive Ads" format, designed to integrate naturally into the game environment.

items.title: T-Mobile closes Lumos deal after dropping DEI
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- T-Mobile has closed its joint venture deal with Lumos, having removed its DEI webpage.
- The DEI page was online until at least March 26 and outlined T-Mobile's culture of inclusion.
- The removal appears to be a response to FCC Chair Brendan Carr's threats regarding DEI policies affecting mergers.
- T-Mobile's executive vice president stated the company is reviewing its DEI policies to comply with FCC regulations.
- The FCC approved the Lumos deal on March 28 after T-Mobile promised not to promote discrimination.
- Carr has also investigated DEI practices at other companies like Comcast, Verizon, and Disney, leading to scrutiny from Democrats in the Energy and Commerce Committee.

items.title: The best phone to buy right now
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Most users prefer familiar phones that work reliably.
- Iterative improvements dominate the current phone market; new devices focus on software more than hardware.
- Notable options include the iPhone 16, Google Pixel 9, and Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra.
- iPhone 16 features A18 chipset, Action Button, and advanced camera system, priced at $799.
- Google Pixel 9 offers great design and reliable camera capabilities at $649 but lacks a telephoto lens.
- The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is touted as the best high-end Android, with top specs and features, priced at $1,100.
- Many budget options available under $600, with specific recommendations for excellent budget smartphones.

items.title: Thousands of federal health workers are losing their jobs in the US
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) is undergoing significant workforce reductions, impacting agencies like the CDC and FDA.
- Thousands of CDC employees were notified of layoffs, reassessments, or remote assignments as part of a 20,000-person workforce reduction initiated by the Trump administration.
- Critics warn that these cuts may lead to preventable deaths due to compromised public health programs, while HHS claims the changes will save $1.8 billion annually.
- FDA officials, including Peter Marks, have resigned, citing a lack of commitment to truth and transparency under the new administration.

items.title: All of the updates about OpenAI
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI raised $40 billion led by SoftBank, reaching a $300 billion valuation.
- ChatGPT is generating Studio Ghibli-style art, leading to a mix of reactions online.
- OpenAI's leadership change includes COO Brad Lightcap overseeing operations as Sam Altman focuses on technical direction.
- OpenAI is facing delays for free-tier users in accessing the new image generation feature due to high demand and operational challenges.
- Privacy concerns arise from a case where a Norwegian man was falsely labeled by ChatGPT as a murderer.

items.title: Must-Have Accessories for Xbox Series X/S
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Xbox Series X and S can be enhanced with various accessories.
- Recommended controllers: 
  - [Xbox Wireless Controller](https://www.amazon.com/Xbox-Wireless-Gaming-Headset-Headphones-Console/dp/B0DH689JGY?tag=theverge02-20): Features share button, Bluetooth support, and USB-C port.
  - [Xbox Elite Series 2 Controller](https://www.amazon.com/Elite-2-Controller-Black-Xbox-One/dp/B07SFKTLZM/?tag=theverge02-20): Offers more customization but at a higher price.
- Storage options include [Seagate](https://www.amazon.com/Seagate-Storage-Expansion-Solid-State/dp/B08K3S6WJM?th=1&tag=theverge02-20) and [Western Digital expansion cards](https://www.amazon.com/WD_Black-Storage-Expansion-Card-WDBMPH0010BNC-WCSN/dp/B0C44XVWCH/?tag=theverge02-20).
- Other accessories featured: PowerA Enhanced Wired Controller, Xbox Wireless Headset, charging stands, and more.

items.title: Keanu Reeves is coming back for John Wick 5
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Lionsgate announced the greenlighting of John Wick 5 during CinemaCon.
- Keanu Reeves will reprise his role as John Wick, also known as Baba Yaga.
- No plot details have been released yet, but director Chad Stahelski and producers Basil Iwanyk and Erica Lee are attached.
- An animated prequel featuring Reeves is also in development, focusing on his past tasks.
- Donnie Yen is set to star in and direct a live-action spinoff centered around his character from John Wick: Chapter 4.

items.title: NFL swaps first-down chains for Sony's 8K cameras
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Starting with the current football season, the NFL will utilize Sony’s Hawk-Eye cameras for measuring first downs.
- The system consists of six 8K cameras utilizing optical tracking, creating a digital measurement to display in stadiums and on TV.
- It is estimated that using this technology will reduce the measurement time to around 30 seconds, significantly faster than the traditional chain crew process.
- The chain crew will remain on the field in a secondary role despite the new technology.
- Sony's Hawk-Eye technology was tested last year and will be implemented in all 30 US NFL stadiums as well as international venues.

items.title: Hyundai’s Insteroid is an EV one-off for gamers
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Hyundai unveils the "Insteroid" concept EV in Seoul, inspired by gaming and street racing.
- The vehicle features a wide body kit, massive spoiler, track wheels, and a stripped interior.
- The Insteroid will also appear in a web-based video game developed by Hyundai.
- The aim is to boost interest in the production model, the Inster, launching in Korea this summer with prices starting under $26,000.

items.title: Runway says its latest AI video model can actually generate consistent scenes and people
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- AI startup Runway introduced its Gen-4 video model for consistent scene generation.
- The model allows for character and object continuity across shots using a single reference image.
- Gen-4 is currently rolling out to paid and enterprise users, enhancing storytelling control.
- A demonstration video showed a woman maintaining her appearance across varying contexts.
- This release follows the Gen-3 Alpha model, which had issues related to training data from YouTube.

items.title: Hundreds of scientists accuse Donald Trump of censorship
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- More than 1,900 scientists and engineers have warned of dangers from the Trump administration’s cuts to scientific research funding.
- A letter states that the administration is destabilizing the research enterprise by cutting funding, firing scientists, and pressuring researchers on ideological grounds.
- The letter's signatories accuse the administration of censorship affecting climate change and vaccine initiatives, highlighting significant impacts on universities and the research community.

items.title: ZeniMax union votes to authorize a strike
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- ZeniMax Workers United, a union of over 300 quality assurance workers, voted with over 94% in favor to authorize a strike.
- The authorization allows the union to call a strike if contract negotiations with Microsoft break down, which have been ongoing for two years.
- Issues raised include employee concerns over wages, benefits, and working conditions, notably the lack of paid sick time and low wages for contractors.
- The union previously conducted a one-day strike over management's response to workplace issues.
- The strike authorization underscores increasing tensions between union members and management regarding employee treatment.

items.title: The FAA hiding private jet details might not stop celebrity jet trackers
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The FAA is implementing a process to protect private jet owners' registration details, potentially complicating the work of celebrity jet trackers like Jack Sweeney.
- Sweeney argues that determining aircraft ownership requires research and connections with media rather than solely relying on the FAA’s database.
- The FAA's plan stems from the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, responding to privacy concerns about jet tracking that affected social media platforms.

items.title: A shady, shuttered tech bootcamp may be sneaking back online
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The CFPB shut down Prehired, a tech sales bootcamp, for deceptive loans burdening students.
- FastTrack is allegedly the new guise under which Prehired may be operating, offering similar terms.
- Prehired was ordered to refund $4.2 million and void $27 million in loans, but has reportedly done little to comply.
- Consumer advocates express concern that FastTrack is replicating Prehired's deceptive practices.
- The weakened CFPB may struggle to enforce regulations against FastTrack amid internal and political challenges.

items.title: Google’s Pixel 10 Pro Fold might be mostly a spec bump
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- The Pixel 10 Pro Fold appears similar to its predecessor, suggesting it may be largely a spec bump.
- Renders show the same camera layout as the Pixel 9 Pro Fold with a hole-punch camera on both displays.
- Dimensions are nearly identical to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold: 6.1 x 5.9 x 0.21 inches.
- Likely features an upgraded Tensor G5 processor and potentially a lower starting price than $1,799.
- Minor improvement noted with a smaller gap between the screen and device's hinge on the left side.

items.title: The best Xbox controller to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Xbox Wireless Controller is the best option for most Xbox or PC gamers due to its balance of quality, comfort, and price.
- Alternatives to consider include options from brands like 8BitDo, PowerA, Razer, Scuf, and Turtle Beach.
- The standard Xbox controller is reasonably priced at around $60 and features great connectivity options including Bluetooth.
- The 8BitDo Ultimate Wired Controller serves as a budget-friendly alternative at about $28, known for its lightweight design and satisfying buttons.
- The Xbox Elite Wireless Controller Series 2 offers extensive customization options but comes with a high price tag of around $150 and some reported quality control issues.

items.title: The Sonos Arc is down to a new all-time low price
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Sonos Arc soundbar is now available for $599, which is $300 off its original price.
- Features include eight woofers, three tweeters, upward-firing Dolby Atmos speakers, and eARC support.
- Can function as both a soundbar and a smart speaker, compatible with Google Assistant, Amazon Alexa, and Apple’s AirPlay 2.
- The Sonos Arc Ultra was released as a more powerful version, priced at $999, offering Bluetooth audio and Trueplay EQ tuning.

items.title: Searching for the perfect minimalist smartphone
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Discussion on the concept of a minimalist smartphone that offers essential features while avoiding distractions.
- Highlights the new Light Phone III and its capabilities.
- Covers the recent Tesla Takedown protests and the demands of the protestors.
- Explores upcoming tariffs affecting the auto industry and new developments in electric vehicles.
- Answers a question about in-home cameras that can locate misplaced items.

items.title: Dbrand’s new skins let you ‘touch grass’ without the hassle of going outside
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Dbrand has launched the Touch Grass collection, allowing users to wrap devices in artificial turf.
- Available for over 100 devices, pricing is $29.95 for smartphones, $49.95 for tablets, and $69.95 for laptops.
- The skins use electrostatic flocking to secure thousands of polyethylene strands, ensuring durability and preventing shedding.
- Traditional cutting methods were replaced with laser cutting to prevent edges from loosening.
- Touch Grass skins serve as unintentional lint catchers but are easy to clean.
- The product raises concerns about contributing to microplastics pollution upon disposal.

items.title: Substack says it’ll legally defend writers ‘targeted by the government’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Substack partners with the nonprofit FIRE to protect foreign writers in the US from government targeting.
- The initiative responds to a recent arrest of a Tufts University student allegedly linked to her criticism of US foreign policy.
- Substack's Defender program has previously offered legal assistance to writers and is expanding its support to those facing government actions.

items.title: Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse swings into theaters in 2027
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Sony officially announced the new release date for *Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse* on June 4th, 2027.
- This announcement was made at CinemaCon, along with a trailer screening and new images featuring main characters Miles Morales and Gwen Stacy.
- Originally planned to release in March 2024, the movie's premiere was delayed due to production challenges, including reports of overworked animators and the impact of the 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike.
- The film's co-directors and producer emphasized that these delays were beneficial for the project's quality.

items.title: How to watch the Switch 2 Direct
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 Direct event will occur on April 2nd at 9AM ET.
- The event will be streamed on Nintendo’s [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@NintendoAmerica/featured) and [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/nintendo) channels, lasting approximately 60 minutes.
- Viewers expect updates on features such as backward compatibility, redesigned Joy-Cons, and a new Mario Kart game, following the earlier announcement in January 2025.

items.title: April Fools’ Day 2025: the best and cringiest pranks
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Brands can choose among four options for April Fools' pranks in 2025: abstain, deliver actual products, clarify jokes, or mislead customers.
- Examples of pranks include Dbrand's 'Touch Grass' skins for gadgets, priced at $29.95 to $69.95.
- Other notable pranks include a dating simulator for Palworld and PUBG, and a humorous Razer headset designed as a brainrot translator.
- Nokia and the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra launched a prank imagining a concert featuring 3310 ringtone performances.

items.title: Elon Musk’s $1 million handout winners are connected to Republican causes
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Elon Musk gave away two $1 million checks at an event in Green Bay, Wisconsin, to incentivize voters against "activist judges."
- Musk’s America PAC promises money to people who sign a petition related to voter registration and turnout.
- The recipients of the checks had affiliations with Republican causes, raising questions about the selection process.
- Legal experts warn that Musk’s actions could potentially violate vote buying laws; the Wisconsin Supreme Court declined to block the giveaway despite legal challenges.

items.title: How to set up Wi-Fi calling on Android and iPhones
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Wi-Fi calling allows phone calls and texts to be routed over Wi-Fi instead of cellular service, useful in areas with poor cell coverage.
- Most major US carriers support Wi-Fi calling on compatible devices.
- To enable Wi-Fi calling on Android Pixel: go to Settings > Network and Internet > SIMs > Wi-Fi Calling, then enable it.
- For Samsung Galaxy: Open Phone app > tap three dots > find Wi-Fi Calling toggle in Quick Settings.
- To set up Wi-Fi calling on iPhone: Go to Settings > Cellular > Wi-Fi Calling, confirm your address for emergency services and enable Wi-Fi Calling.

items.title: Gmail is making it easier for businesses to send encrypted emails to anyone
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google updates Gmail to enable enterprise users to send encrypted emails to any inbox.
- New encryption model allows secure messaging without custom software or encryption certificates.
- Feature is rolling out in beta, expected to be available for all Gmail users soon.
- Non-Gmail users will receive a link to view and reply to encrypted messages.
- The encryption process is more advanced than standard Transport Layer Security but not end-to-end encryption.

items.title: Spec-tacular week
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Explores the impact of standards on technology and productivity.
- Discusses efficient streaming video codecs and power measurements.
- Addresses frustrations with Micro USB and its implications on gadget compatibility.

items.title: Why the watt is the most important spec in battery-powered devices
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The watt is a crucial metric for understanding the performance of batteries and processors in devices.
- Manufacturers often prefer using mAh and GHz, which do not accurately reflect a device's power.
- Example given of the Steam Deck gaming handheld to illustrate how watts determine battery usage and life.
- Watts indicate energy usage, battery capacity, and cooling requirements for processors.
- Many companies obscure wattage to present more impressive specifications, leading to consumer confusion about device performance.

items.title: How to calculate your home battery needs for the next blackout
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Understanding watt-hours (Wh) is crucial for calculating battery needs during blackouts.
- A typical US home consumes about 29.2 kWh per day, necessitating significant battery investment for backup.
- Many calculators can help estimate your power needs based on essential devices and their usage.
- Amp-hours (Ah) can be converted to watt-hours using the device's voltage.
- Most US homes experience about five to eight hours of outages per year, highlighting the importance of reliable power solutions.
- It's advisable to purchase at least 10% more battery capacity than calculated to cover unexpected usage.
- Battery systems for homes and RVs vary significantly in capacity and can be expanded as needed for increased power demand.

items.title: Zuckerberg's Strategy Amid Upcoming EU Fines Against Meta
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- EU fines against Meta are anticipated due to violations of the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- Mark Zuckerberg has established ties with Donald Trump, contributing $1 million to Trump's inauguration.
- Under the DMA, Meta could face up to $16 billion in penalties based on its 2024 revenue.
- The EU ruling may affect Meta's European revenue, prompting concerns about personalized ads.
- Zuckerberg has publicly criticized EU regulations and enlisted US trade officials' help to contest the fines.

items.title: ChatGPT’s improved image generation is now available for free
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- ChatGPT's new image generator is now available for free users after initial delays.
- CEO Sam Altman confirmed the rollout on X, stating there are limitations on usage.
- The updated generator, powered by the GPT-4o model, was launched on March 25, 2023.
- Free users are reported to have access to three image generations per day.
- OpenAI raised $40 billion in funding, marking the largest private tech funding round in history.

items.title: Palworld and PUBG are getting dating sims
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Developers of Palworld and PUBG announced dating simulators set in their game universes.
- Palworld dating sim, titled 'Pal♡world! ~More Than Just Pals~', was preceded by a trailer and an official Steam listing, with a release date yet to be announced.
- Players in Palworld will interact with characters as friends or pursue romantic relationships.
- PUBG's dating sim, 'Winner Winner Romantic Dinner', is an April Fools' Day promotion featuring characters inspired by the game's weapons, available from April 1 to April 29.

items.title: Finally, an e-bike that charges off USB-C
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Ampler introduces the Nova and Nova Pro e-bikes with USB-C charging capability.
- Bikes can charge from 0 to full in about three hours using a USB-C PD 3.1 charger.
- Prices are €2,990 for the Nova and €3,490 for the Nova Pro, with preorders starting now and shipping in June.

items.title: OpenAI just raised another $40 billion round led by SoftBank
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI raised $40 billion in a new funding round led by SoftBank, reaching a valuation of $300 billion.  
- Largest funding round for a private tech company in history, according to CNBC.  
- OpenAI will receive $10 billion initially, with $30 billion more contingent on becoming a for-profit by year’s end.  
- This funding follows OpenAI's Stargate project, a $500 billion venture for AI datacenters.  
- OpenAI recently gained 1 million users in one hour due to a new feature in ChatGPT.  
- Expected revenue jumps from $3.7 billion to $12.7 billion this year, but still not projected to be cash flow positive until 2029.  
- OpenAI aims to develop AGI that benefits all of humanity, requiring significant resources and funding.

items.title: The Space Race Heats Up: Latest Rocket Launches and News
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Andoya Spaceport's first orbital launch attempt lasted about 30 seconds before being aborted due to trajectory issues.
- NASA and Boeing are addressing in-flight anomalies of the Starliner spacecraft before its next flight, expected in 2026.
- Katy Perry will join others for Blue Origin's first all-female flight on April 14, 2025, aboard the New Shepard rocket.
- SpaceX Crew-9 and Boeing Starliner astronauts successfully returned to Earth after their respective missions.
- SpaceX's latest Starship flight test ended in failure as the rocket exploded during its eighth test flight.

items.title: Robot vacuums are getting upgraded support for Apple Home
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple's iOS 18.4 update includes support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app via the Matter protocol.
- Companies like Roborock, iRobot, and Ecovacs are releasing firmware updates for enhanced compatibility.
- Notable Roborock models receiving updates include the S8 MaxV Ultra and Saros series, scheduled for firmware release between April 1st and 10th.
- iRobot's Roomba Combo 10 Max will be the first compliant with Matter and Apple Home, enabling control through the Home app and Siri.
- Ecovacs is rolling out Matter 1.4 firmware updates for models like Deebot X2 starting today, with phased availability.
- Original announcement for support of robot vacuums in Apple Home was made during WWDC 2024.

items.title: Microsoft expands AI features across Intel and AMD-powered Copilot Plus PCs
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft releases AI features on Copilot Plus PCs with Intel and AMD chips.
- Key feature: Live Captions translates audio to English subtitles in real time.
- Live Captions available from latest Windows 11 update.
- New tool Cocreator in Paint generates images based on text descriptions.
- Access to AI image editor and generator in the Photos app is expanded.
- Features were earlier limited to devices with Qualcomm chips.
- Ongoing testing of the Recall feature for searching screenshots from activities.

items.title: SwitchBot’s smart button pusher is 30 percent off for Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The SwitchBot Bot is on sale for $20.99 (originally $29.99) using promo code BKLP15 or $22.49 on Amazon.
- It automates devices with buttons, including garage doors, light switches, and appliances.
- Supports voice commands via Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, and Siri when paired with a SwitchBot hub.
- Does not work on toggle switches and requires a separate hub for remote control.
- The SwitchBot Hub Mini is also on sale for $27.99.

items.title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals you can still grab for under $30
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale runs until March 31, 2025, offering deals without a Prime membership requirement.
- Featured products include:
  - [JLab Bluetooth earbuds](https://www.amazon.com/JLab-Bluetooth-Resistance-Connection-Signature/dp/B0CXGXT6W8?tag=theverge02-20) for a budget-friendly price.
  - [Baseus retractable USB-C charger](https://www.amazon.com/Baseus-Retractable-Charging-7-Stage-Charger/dp/B0C858GPF9/?tag=theverge02-20) priced at $10.
  - [Anker USB-C Hub](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07ZVKTP53?th=1&tag=theverge02-20) selling for $25.
  - [Soundcore Bluetooth speaker](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DB1753RZ/?tag=theverge02-20) at $20.
  - A variety of tech accessories and gadgets are highlighted as great low-cost deals available now.

items.title: iOS 18.4 is out now with Apple Intelligence-powered priority notifications
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- iOS 18.4 introduces priority notifications utilizing Apple Intelligence to highlight important alerts.
- Notifications are prioritized and appear at the top of the notification stack on the Home Screen.
- The update expands Apple Intelligence language support to French, German, Italian, Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Chinese (simplified), as well as localized English for Singapore and India.
- Available now on Vision Pro as part of visionOS 2.4, introducing a Vision Pro app for iOS to assist users in finding headset content.
- Additional features include a recipes section for News Plus subscribers and several enhancements to Photos.

items.title: Plex is rolling out its big app redesign
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Plex is rolling out its redesigned mobile app to Android and iOS devices within a week.
- The new app features an updated navigation system, a Watchlist button, and improved artwork for shows and movies.
- Improvements include faster load times, scrolling, a sleep timer, and picture-in-picture support.
- Future updates will allow downloading entire seasons, casting to more devices, and revised UI for ratings and reviews.
- Plex is also increasing the Plex Pass subscription price to $6.99 starting April 29th, with remote playback now requiring a subscription.

items.title: Amazon’s new AI agent is designed to do your shopping
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched a new AI model, **Nova Act**, for online shopping tasks in the browser, currently available in a research preview for developers.
- Nova Act can perform web searches, make purchases, and execute detailed instructions, such as avoiding upsells during a transaction.
- This model is part of Amazon's **Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) Labs**, which aims to enable agents to manage complex tasks, with the aspiration of enhancing business productivity.
- Nova Act is the first product released following the announcement of five Nova models in December 2024, focusing on speed and cost-effectiveness compared to competitors.
- Amazon is also providing easier access to their AI models through a new website for developers, who previously accessed them via Amazon Bedrock.

items.title: Alexa Plus just launched in early access, but it’s missing some features
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched its AI-powered **Alexa Plus** in early access for a limited number of customers.
- The service lacks some advertised features such as budgeting gift ideas and grocery ordering.
- Currently available only on **Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21** devices, with capabilities like ordering Uber and document summarization.
- **Alexa Plus** subscription costs **$19.99 per month**, also free for Prime members.
- Features are expected to be launched in waves over time, with ongoing improvements planned.

items.title: Max’s rebranded logo and colors look very HBO
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Max introduces a new black-and-white logo and branding that recalls HBO’s classic style.
- The change aligns the streaming service, previously bright blue, more closely with HBO's iconic image.
- This rebranding follows the announcement of Max's availability in Australia.
- The new visual identity will be rolled out over the next few months across various platforms.
- The service was previously rebranded from HBO Max to Max after the merger of HBO Max and Discovery Plus in 2023.

items.title: Amazon’s Big Spring Sale Ending Soon: Last Chance for Discounts
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The Big Spring Sale on Amazon is concluding tonight, March 31, 2025.
- Major discounts on tech products available, potentially not seen until Prime Day.
- Featured deals include video doorbells, headphones, smartwatches, air purifiers, and more.
- Prime membership generally ensures quicker shipping, but many deals are accessible to non-members.
- Competing retailers like Best Buy, Walmart, and Target are also being monitored for deals.
- Notable featured deals involve high-quality products such as Anker chargers, Hoto screwdrivers, Apple AirPods Pro, LG OLED TVs, and more.

items.title: Want to feel like a spy? Stick a smart chip in your manicure
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Jakcom N3 Smart Nail Chip uses NFC technology to allow users to send data to their phone by tapping it to the nail.
- It is inexpensive, with prices ranging around $20 for sets of chips.
- Users can program the chip to link to social media, e-commerce, and other functions, though the data storage interface is described as confusing.
- The chip's application can be challenging; it requires precise placement and may not be durable in wet conditions.
- After several trials, the best placement was found to be under the edge of medium-to-long press-on nails for optimal scanning.
- Using Apple’s Shortcuts app expands the chip's functions significantly, allowing automation like sending messages or performing tasks with a quick scan.

items.title: CEO Matt Bromberg on ending Unity’s ‘war’ against its customers
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Matt Bromberg, CEO of Unity, discusses changes he implemented after joining the company amid customer dissatisfaction and turmoil.
- Bromberg highlights the importance of Unity in the gaming ecosystem, powering many mobile and independent games.
- The previous pricing model change, known as the runtime fee, led to severe backlash and the resignation of the former CEO, John Riccitiello.
- Bromberg chose to scrap the runtime fee, seeing it as crucial for Unity's future success.
- He talks about Unity's current focus and growth opportunities outside gaming, including applications in automotive and other industries.

items.title: Coyote vs. Acme is getting its day in theaters
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery sells global distribution rights of *Coyote vs. Acme* to Ketchup Entertainment for approximately $50 million.
- Ketchup plans to release the film, directed by Dave Green, in theaters in 2026.
- The film had been shelved in 2023 for a $30 million tax write-off; Warner Bros. had rejected other offers from Amazon, Netflix, and Paramount.
- Ketchup’s CEO expresses excitement about the film's blend of nostalgia and modern storytelling.

items.title: The 1TB Xbox Series X expansion card is back down to its lowest price ever
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The 1TB WD Black C50 expansion card is discounted by 26% to $109.99, down from a typical price of around $150.
- This sale coincides with World Backup Day and Amazon’s Big Spring Sale.
- The card is suitable for Xbox Series X/S consoles and ensures faster game load times and ample storage space for large game files like Grand Theft Auto VI.

items.title: Apple fined $162 million for hurting app developers with ‘excessively complex’ privacy options
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- France's competition watchdog fined Apple €150 million (~$162.4 million) for its App Tracking Transparency system, which was deemed harmful to small publishers.
- The system, launched in 2021, requires two pop-ups for user tracking permission, while location tracking for Apple's apps requires only one tap.
- The French authority argues the initiative makes third-party app usage excessively complex compared to Apple apps, impacting revenue for companies like Snapchat and Facebook by nearly $10 billion.
